Description:
OverviewThis position description is subject to change at any time as needed to meet the requirements of the program or company.Serve as technical expert and lead engineer for all NAVCENT/C5F/MOC/CMF systems (SIPRNET, NIPRNET, SCI LANs, CENTRIXS, BICES, JWICS, DCGS-N, FMV, GCCS-J Family of Systems (FoS) and GCCS-M and others). TS-SCI Clearance required.ResponsibilitiesMajor Job Activities: Act as technical expert and lead engineer for all NAVCENT/C5F/MOC/CMF systems.
Support Microsoft, Cisco, VMWare, Solaris and network security technologies and architecture.
Oversee the design and implementation of NAVCENT core technologies.
Oversee NAVCENT C4I systems cybersecurity posture and system architectures.Material & Equipment Directly Used: Navy classified and unclassified C4ISR computer systems and ONE-NET.Working Environment: Candidate will work primarily in computer facilities at Naval commands in an office or computer equipment room environment. Work outside of normal work week hours will be required to participate in meetings, troubleshooting efforts, and installations or upgrades. Physical Activities: Personnel may be required to stand or sit for prolonged periods of time.  Individual must be able to lift up to 30 lbs. unassisted.
The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; visual inspection of installed computer and network equipment.QualificationsMinimum Qualifications: BS in Information Technology (or equivalent technical degree) or 7+ years technical experience in related discipline required.
Certification as IAT-III (per DoD Inst 8750.1 and Navy guidance) required. CASP+ CE, CCNP Security, CISA, CISSP (or Associate), GCED or GCIH with IA and CE required. 
7+ years’ experience with Navy or DoD Networks (SIPRNET, NIPRNET, SCI)
7+ years’ experience C4I Systems experience: CENTRIXS, BICES, JWICS, DCGS-N, FMV, GCCS-J Family of Systems (FoS) and GCCS-M and others, Coalition Partner Network (CPN-X) and other C2 Systems Administration.
Strong understanding of cybersecurity and the ability to plan secure architectures.
Active DoD TS-SCI Security Clearance. Experience / Skills: Technical expertise and engineering of NAVCENT/C5F/MOC/CMF systems (SIPRNET, NIPRNET & SCI LANs, CENTRIXS, BICES, JWICS, DCGS-N, FMV, GCCS-J Family of Systems (FoS), GCCS-M and others).
Detailed knowledge of MOC C2 systems to include knowledge of fleet communications and architectures.
Strong understanding of cybersecurity and the ability to plan secure architectures.
Must be able to communicate well both orally and in writing.
Must be able to communicate well with senior Navy / DoD officials and technical personnel.
Candidate must be able to provide training as needed.Supervisory / Budget Responsibilities:  N/AWe are committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace that values and supports the contributions of each individual. This commitment along with our common Vision and Values of Integrity, Respect, and Responsibility, allows us to leverage differences, encourage innovation and expand our success in the global marketplace. Vectrus is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability. EOE/Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.Minimum Qualifications: BS in Information Technology (or equivalent technical degree) or 7+ years technical experience in related discipline required.
Certification as IAT-III (per DoD Inst 8750.1 and Navy guidance) required. CASP+ CE, CCNP Security, CISA, CISSP (or Associate), GCED or GCIH with IA and CE required.

7+ years’ experience C4I Systems experience: CENTRIXS, BICES, JWICS, DCGS-N, FMV, GCCS-J Family of Systems (FoS) and GCCS-M and others, Coalition Partner Network (CPN-X) and other C2 Systems Administration.
